categories.name: Diseases
categories.description: Information about common cattle diseases and their treatments.

resources.title: Foot and Mouth Disease
resources.content: Foot-and-mouth disease (FMD) is a contagious viral disease that affects cloven-hoofed animals like cattle. It causes fever and blisters in the mouth, hooves, and other parts of the body. Immediate quarantine and vaccination are crucial for control.
resources.author: World Organization for Animal Health (OIE)

resources.title: Bovine Tuberculosis
resources.content: Bovine tuberculosis (bTB) is a chronic bacterial infection caused by *Mycobacterium bovis*, which primarily affects cattle, but can also affect other animals and humans. It spreads through the air when infected animals cough.
resources.author: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

categories.name: Feeding Practices
categories.description: Guidelines for feeding cattle to maintain health and productivity.

resources.title: Balanced Diet for Dairy Cattle
resources.content: Dairy cattle require a balanced diet consisting of forages, grains, and protein supplements to meet their nutritional needs. High-quality silage and fresh water are essential for optimal milk production.
resources.author: National Dairy Council

resources.title: Proper Nutrition for Beef Cattle
resources.content: Beef cattle need a diet that includes high-fiber forages, grains, and vitamins. The goal is to ensure cattle grow at an optimal rate and gain weight efficiently before slaughter.

categories.name: Hygiene
categories.description: Best practices for maintaining hygiene in cattle management.

resources.title: Maintaining Clean Barns for Healthy Cattle
resources.content: Clean barns reduce the risk of infections and improve animal welfare. Regular cleaning and disinfection of barns, feed areas, and water sources are essential to prevent the spread of diseases.
resources.author: American Veterinary Medical Association (AVMA)

resources.title: Importance of Grooming Cattle
resources.content: Grooming cattle not only helps in maintaining good skin health but also reduces the risk of parasites. Regular brushing and bathing keep cattle clean and stress-free.
resources.author: Farm Animal Care Trust

categories.name: Animal Welfare
categories.description: Guidelines for improving the welfare and health of cattle.

resources.title: Cattle Welfare in Hot Weather
resources.content: During hot weather, cattle are at risk of heat stress. Ensure adequate access to clean water, provide shaded areas, and avoid transportation during peak heat hours.
resources.author: Humane Society International

categories.name: Breed Information
categories.description: Information on different cattle breeds and their characteristics.

resources.title: Holstein Cattle Characteristics
resources.content: Holstein cattle are known for their excellent milk production. They are the most common dairy breed in the world, characterized by black-and-white markings.
resources.author: International Dairy Federation

categories.name: Cattle Health
categories.description: Articles on ensuring good health for cattle.

resources.title: Preventing Common Cattle Diseases
resources.content: Vaccination and biosecurity measures are essential to prevent diseases like Bovine Respiratory Disease (BRD) and Johne's disease in cattle.
resources.author: World Health Organization (WHO)
